did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, a notebook, a diary, and a manuscript.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Thirty-eight letters from Rankin mainly to her mother concerning social life, household management, and travels to India where her husband, Everett H. Rankin, was a Standard Oil representative; a notebook of information she collected on Indian trees; and her diary. Also, her unfinished biography of Liberty Hyde Bailey and a letter from Romeyn Berry.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Thirty-eight letters (1937) from Rankin mainly to her mother concerning social life, household management, and travels to India where her husband, Everett H. Rankin (Cornell University Class of 1912), was a Standard Oil representative; a notebook of information she collected on Indian trees (1938); and her diary (1939-1943). Also, her unfinished biography of Liberty Hyde Bailey (319 page typescript) and a letter (1952) from Romeyn Berry, who comments on the completed portion, which deals with Bailey's life up until the time he came to Cornell.

did.unittitle: Typescript copy of Louise Spieker Rankin's biography of Liberty Hyde Bailey.

scopecontent.p: Thirty-eight letters (Jan. 8-Dec. 27, 1937, 65 pcs.) from Louise Rankin written during her stay in India with her husband Everett Horace Rankin (Cornell '12), a Standard Oil representative. Almost entirely to her mother, the letters concern her social life, her difficulties in managing the household and servants, and her travels in India. See accession folder for a detailed description of letters.

did.unittitle: One volume containing information on Indian trees collected by Mrs. Rankin
